meanings.definition: Having a more pleasant taste or smell than something else.
meanings.sent1: The soup was savourier than the plain bread.
meanings.sent2: The cake was much savourier than the crackers.
meanings.sent3: The savourier aroma of the coffee filled the entire room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as savourier as a melody in the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The fresh strawberries were so savourier that they seemed to dance on my taste buds.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is more enjoyable or appealing than another.
meanings.sent1: She was the savourier of the two sisters, always bringing joy to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The new movie was a savourier compared to the old one.
meanings.sent3: The puppy became the savourier of the family with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were like a savourier, always making people smile.
meanings.sent5: The painting stood out as the savourier in the art gallery, capturing everyone's attention.
